info.name: Magic Items
info.description: Magic Items from The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

element.name: Ancient Close-fitting Armour
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Elven, Dwarven
A skilful smith has made this armour more difficult to overcome with critical hits. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

element.name: Ancient Cunning Make Armour
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Elven, Dwarven

You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armour. This armour is half the normal weight. If it normally imposes disadvantage on fatigue saving throws, this version doesn't. Otherwise, the maximum Dexterity modifier you can add to your AC when you wear it increases by 1.

element.name: Archet Hunting Bow
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: When making a weapon attack roll with an Archet hunting bow, you can use your Wisdom modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls. In addition, when you score a critical hit with an Archet hunting bow, you can roll one additional weapon damage die and add it to the extra damage.

element.name: Biting Dart Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Elven
Special: Bane
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. If you hit a bane creature using this weapon, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

element.name: Cleaving Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Any
You can make one melee attack with this magic weapon as a bonus action on each of your turns.

element.name: Close-fitting Armour
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: A skilful smith has made this armour more difficult to overcome with critical hits. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

element.name: Cunning-make Armour
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: A skilled craftsman has made this armour lighter or less cumbersome than its lesser counterparts. The armour is half the normal weight. If it normally imposes disadvantage on fatigue saving throws, this version doesn't. Otherwise, the maximum Dexterity modifier you can add to your AC when you wear it increases by 1.

element.name: Fell Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Hard and straight, a critical hit from this weapon is more dangerous. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, you can roll two additional weapon damage dice and add them to the extra damage.

You cannot apply this reward to a weapon that has the ammunition property, but you can apply it to one piece of ammunition instead, that you can choose to expend after you roll the die for the attack roll, but before the Loremaster tells you whether you hit or miss. You can always recover this piece of ammunition at the end of a battle.

element.name: Fell Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Hard and straight, a critical hit from this weapon is more dangerous. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, you can roll two additional weapon damage dice and add them to the extra damage.

You cannot apply this reward to a weapon that has the ammunition property, but you can apply it to one piece of ammunition instead, that you can choose to expend after you roll the die for the attack roll, but before the Loremaster tells you whether you hit or miss. You can always recover this piece of ammunition at the end of a battle.

element.name: Flame of Hope Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Dwarven

While you hold this magic weapon drawn, it creates an aura in a 10-foot radius around you. Whenever you or a friendly creature in the aura must make a saving throw during combat, the creature gains a bonus to the saving throw equal to your Charisma modifier (with a minimum bonus of +1).

element.name: Foe-Slaying Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Elven, Númenórean
Special: Bane
When you hit a bane creature with this magic weapon, you can roll one additional weapon damage die, or two additional dice if it is of Elven craftsmanship.

element.name: Gleam of Terror Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Elven, Dwarven

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. As a bonus action, you can cause the weapon emit dim light in a radius equal to its reach until the start of your next turn. The light is sunlight. While the weapon gleams, it also deals radiant damage instead of its normal type.

element.name: Grievous Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: The weapon is strong and heavy, inflicting more harm on its targets. You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls with this weapon.

element.name: Hammering Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: any

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, when you hit a creature with it, the creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or fall prone.

element.name: Hollow Steel Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Númenórean
sPECIAL: no Bane required
You can make one ranged attack with this magic weapon as a bonus action on each of your turns.

element.name: Keen Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Sharp or better-balanced, this weapon is now more likely to produce a critical hit when hitting its target. Attacks using this weapon score a critical hit on a roll of 19–20.

div.h5: Keen Weapons Using The One Ring Dice
div.p: If you are using a set of The One Ring Success Dice, a Keen weapon scores a critical hit also when the dice show two or more 5 results, or three 5 results if you have disadvantage on the roll. A Superior Keen weapon additionally scores a critical hit against bane creatures when the dice show two or more 4 results, or three 4 results if you have disadvantage.

element.name: Luminescence Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Elven
Special: Bane

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The weapon glows with a pale, cold light when a bane creature is within 500 feet of it, shedding dim light in a radius equal to its reach. While the weapon is glowing, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you that can see you cannot be surprised by these creatures, and have advantage on initiative rolls.

element.name: Mithril Mail-shirt
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Dwarven

A Mithril mail-shirt is half its normal weight, and can be worn under normal clothes. When you are wearing it, your base Armour Class is 14 + your Dexterity modifier (max 4), and you are considered proficient with it if you have proficiency with light armour.

element.name: Reinforced Shield
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: The shield's structure is reinforced, possibly with a metal rim or a larger iron boss, letting its wearer parry blows with greater ease. While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

element.name: Rune-Scored Armour
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Dwarven
You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this armour.

element.name: Rune-Scored Shield
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Dwarven
While holding this shield, you gain a +1 bonus to AC (in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC) and saving throws.

element.name: Rune-Scored Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Dwarven
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While the weapon is on your person, you also gain a +1 bonus to saving throws.

element.name: Straight Flight Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Any

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you make a ranged attack roll with this magic weapon, your target gains no benefit from cover, other than total cover, and you suffer no disadvantage due to long range.

element.name: Superior Fell Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Elven, Númenórean
Craftsmanship: Bane (if Númenórean)

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, you can roll two additional weapon damage dice when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with this weapon. This increases to three additional dice if it is of Elven craftsmanship, or to four additional dice against bane creatures (if Númenórean).
You cannot apply this enchanted reward to a weapon that has the ammunition property, but you can apply it to one piece of ammunition instead, in the same way as Fell (see Chapter 4).

element.name: Superior Fell Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Elven, Númenórean
Craftsmanship: Bane (if Númenórean)

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, you can roll two additional weapon damage dice when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with this weapon. This increases to three additional dice if it is of Elven craftsmanship, or to four additional dice against bane creatures (if Númenórean).
You cannot apply this enchanted reward to a weapon that has the ammunition property, but you can apply it to one piece of ammunition instead, in the same way as Fell (see Chapter 4).

element.name: Superior Grievous Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Dwarven, Númenórean
Craftsmanship: Bane (if Númenórean)

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The bonus to damage rolls increases to +2 if it is of Dwarven craftsmanship, or to +3 against bane creatures (if Númenórean).

element.name: Superior Grievous Weapon (Dwarven)
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Dwarven, Númenórean
Craftsmanship: Bane (if Númenórean)

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The bonus to damage rolls increases to +2 if it is of Dwarven craftsmanship, or to +3 against bane creatures (if Númenórean).

element.name: Superior Grievous Weapon (Númenórean)
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Dwarven, Númenórean
Craftsmanship: Bane (if Númenórean)

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The bonus to damage rolls increases to +2 if it is of Dwarven craftsmanship, or to +3 against bane creatures (if Númenórean).

element.name: Superior Keen Weapon
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Dwarven, Elven
Craftsmanship: Bane (if Elven)
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, attacks using this weapon score a critical hit on a roll of 19–20, or 18–20 against bane creatures (if Elven).

div.h5: Keen Weapons Using The One Ring Dice
div.p: If you are using a set of The One Ring Success Dice, a Keen weapon scores a critical hit also when the dice show two or more 5 results, or three 5 results if you have disadvantage on the roll. A Superior Keen weapon additionally scores a critical hit against bane creatures when the dice show two or more 4 results, or three 4 results if you have disadvantage.

element.name: Superior Reinforced Shield
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Any
Craftsmanship: Bane (if Númenórean)

While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. The bonus increases to +2 if the shield is of Dwarven or Elven craftsmanship, or to +3 against attacks from bane creatures (if Númenórean). This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

element.name: Superior Reinforced Shield (Elven)
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Any
Craftsmanship: Bane (if Númenórean)

While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. The bonus increases to +2 if the shield is of Dwarven or Elven craftsmanship, or to +3 against attacks from bane creatures (if Númenórean). This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

element.name: Superior Reinforced Shield (Númenórean)
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: Craftsmanship: Any
Craftsmanship: Bane (if Númenórean)

While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. The bonus increases to +2 if the shield is of Dwarven or Elven craftsmanship, or to +3 against attacks from bane creatures (if Númenórean). This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

element.name: Craft
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: You gain a craft slot and a craft of your choice from the Scholar's Crafts list.

element.name: Fighting Style
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: You can choose a fighting style option from the Champion's Fighting Style feature. As normal, you cannot take a Fighting Style option more than once.

element.name: Hit Die
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: You gain a Hit Die, a d6, and your hit points maximum increases by 1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier.
Special. You may take this feature multiple times.

element.name: Reward
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: You choose a reward.
Special. You may take this feature multiple times.

element.name: Sneak Attack
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: You gain the Sneak Attack feature. The extra damage is 1d6.

element.name: Sneak Attack
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: You know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.
You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

sheet.description: Once per turn, you can deal an extra {{lrrp:boon:sneak attack:count}}d{{lrrp:boon:sneak attack:die}} damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon. You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

element.name: Virtue
element.source: The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying

description.p: You gain a common or cultural virtue of your choice.
